  • 2008-07-03 08:34:55

    Re: Adding scorm package to a lesson

    The administrator needs to install the Packages module. You appear to importing a SCO, rather than a content package.

    Once installed and enabled, go to

    Manage>Packages

  • 2008-07-08 10:51:06

    Re: Adding scorm package to a lesson

    What we have discovered is the filenames in the package have spaces in them, and replaced with urlencoded spaces (%20), which ATutor does not know how to handle.



    [php]

    <file href="C2%20Legislation%20for%20PWD%20in%20England.html" />


    [/php]


    We've added a workaround to ATutor, which will be available in a patch soon. You can install it using the Patcher. In the meantime it is a good idea to create file names without spaces. On linux system (including Mac), the spaces can be a problem, while windows it won't be. To keep your packages fully cross platform compatible, you should avoid spaces for your file names.

  • 2008-11-05 08:45:08

    Re: Adding scorm package to a lesson

    What exactly are you trying to do?

    SCORM packages require the Packages module be installed. It should be relatively straight forward once installed. You add packages through the Packages tool, under the instructor's Manage tab.

  • 2008-11-05 12:10:11

    Re: Adding scorm package to a lesson

    Settings is disabled until it can be fixed. The maintainer is no longer maintaining the module, and no one has offered to fund further development, so it will remain turned of for the near future.

    If you want to hide the package, turn the package tool off in Student Tools until you are ready to make the package available.


  • 2008-11-05 12:23:08

    I have uploaded the package, but how can the package be seen by the student?


  • 2008-11-05 12:37:59

    Re: Adding scorm package to a lesson

    To make it visible, just turn on the Packages tool in Student Tools under the Manage tab, either adding it as a tab across the top with the rest of the tabs, or to the home page as a Package icon.

    Students click the packages icon, and a list of available packages appear.
